TopicTitle: Do you go around the rocks?

Articles.Content:
So there are these lovely rocks strewn about the landscapes of the different worlds, but their not exactly rock solid. You can just drive, walk, or fly straight through them.

I pretend they are solid and try to go round them. It really adds to the challenge of trying to drive fast across Mun, but I've have lost several rovers in horrific crashes as a consequence. I nearly crashed my grand tour craft on Pol as I had to move over a bit to avoid a cluster of them.

So what do you do? Do you also pretend that they are solid and carefully try to avoid them, or do you go crashing through them?

Will they ever be solid?
You mean you can actually drive THROUGH them??!! I always considered them solid objects and I never even tried to bump one of them....
Yeah I try to avoid them. Presumably they'll get a collision mesh in a future update, and I don't want to start a bad habit and eventually smack into one when they become solid.
